title: How to Make Lavender Sugar

steps.headline: Prepare the lavender.
steps.description: After drying your lavender post picking, whip up a little muslin bag. Fill this bag with the lavender and seal either by stitching or with a new, clean ribbon.

steps.headline: Fill a jar halfway with quality sugar.
Add the lavender bag in the middle of the jar.
Fill the rest of the jar to the top, burying the bag of lavender in the middle.
Allow to stand for a month.
steps.description: Shake occasionally to shift the sugar and flavour around.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: The sugar will be ready for use after about one month; taste to see if it is strong enough for your liking. Pour some of the sugar into a separate container for serving with tea or into a cooking storage container (for example, use when making lavender and lemon cookies).

steps.headline: Refill.
steps.description: You can continue to refill the sugar jar as many times as desired, to maintain a constant supply of lavender sugar.

text: Prepare the lavender. After drying your lavender post picking, whip up a little muslin bag. Fill this bag with the lavender and seal either by stitching or with a new, clean ribbon. Fill a jar halfway with quality sugar.  Add the lavender bag in the middle of the jar.  Fill the rest of the jar to the top, burying the bag of lavender in the middle.  Allow to stand for a month. Shake occasionally to shift the sugar and flavour around. Use. The sugar will be ready for use after about one month; taste to see if it is strong enough for your liking. Pour some of the sugar into a separate container for serving with tea or into a cooking storage container (for example, use when making lavender and lemon cookies). Refill. You can continue to refill the sugar jar as many times as desired, to maintain a constant supply of lavender sugar.
